controls.name: KSI-CED-01
controls.description: Ensure all employees receive security awareness training.

controlFamily.name: Cybersecurity Education
controlFamily.description: A secure cloud service provider will continuously educate their employees on cybersecurity measures, testing them regularly to ensure their knowledge is satisfactory

controls.name: KSI-CED-02
controls.description: Require role-specific training for high-risk roles, including at least roles with privileged access.

controlFamily.name: Cybersecurity Education
controlFamily.description: A secure cloud service provider will continuously educate their employees on cybersecurity measures, testing them regularly to ensure their knowledge is satisfactory

controls.name: KSI-CMT-01
controls.description: Log and monitor system modifications.

controlFamily.name: Change Management
controlFamily.description: A secure cloud service provider will ensure that all system changes are properly documented and configuration baselines are updated accordingly.

evidence.name: deploy pipelines for the infrastructure
evidence.description: this evidence shows the pipelines that are running to deploy the infrastructure for the application

controls.name: KSI-CMT-02
controls.description: Execute changes through redeployment of version controlled immutable resources rather than direct modification wherever possible.

controlFamily.name: Configuration Management
controlFamily.description: A secure cloud service provider will ensure that all system changes are properly documented and configuration baselines are updated accordingly.

evidence.name: deploy pipelines for the infrastructure
evidence.description: this evidence shows the pipelines that are running to deploy the infrastructure for the application

controls.name: KSI-CMT-03
controls.description: Implement automated testing and validation of changes prior to deployment.

controlFamily.name: Configuration Management
controlFamily.description: A secure cloud service provider will ensure that all system changes are properly documented and configuration baselines are updated accordingly.

evidence.name: Automated testing pipelines
evidence.description: this evidence shows the automated running of the tests and validation of the code

controls.name: KSI-CMT-04
controls.description: Have a documented change management procedure.

controlFamily.name: Change Management
controlFamily.description: A secure cloud service provider will ensure that all system changes are properly documented and configuration baselines are updated accordingly.

evidence.name: KSI-CMT-04_Anitian CM Procedures_v0.3
evidence.description: This evidence provides a detailed, documented change management procedure that outlines how system changes are proposed, reviewed, approved, implemented, and recorded, fulfilling the requirement for a documented change management procedure.

controls.name: KSI-CMT-05
controls.description: Evaluate the risk and potential impact of any change.

controlFamily.name: Change Management
controlFamily.description: A secure cloud service provider will ensure that all system changes are properly documented and configuration baselines are updated accordingly.

evidence.name: SDLC Documentation
evidence.description: This documentation outlines the for Anitian which uses a consistent, risk-informed approach for applying changes and security patches.

controls.name: KSI-CNA-01
controls.description: Configure ALL information resources to limit inbound and outbound traffic.

controlFamily.name: Cloud Native Architecture
controlFamily.description: A secure cloud service offering will use cloud native architecture and design principles to enforce and enhance the Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability of the system.

evidence.name: Firewall policy definitions applied to the network
evidence.description: This evidence shows all firewall policies on the system network that are active and enforce limiting inbound and outbound traffic based on country codes, destinations, traffic type.

evidence.name: Firewall rules limit inbound and outbound traffic
evidence.description: This evidence shows all firewall rules on the system network that are active and enforce limiting inbound and outbound traffic by port, direction and source IP.

controls.name: KSI-CNA-02
controls.description: Design systems to minimize the attack surface and minimize lateral movement if compromised.

controlFamily.name: Cloud Native Architecture
controlFamily.description: A secure cloud service offering will use cloud native architecture and design principles to enforce and enhance the Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability of the system.

evidence.name: Istio enforcing strict networking policies
evidence.description: This document shows the Istio destination rules that limit inbound and inter-pod traffic to specific services, ports and protocols. All services must explicitly enable inbound traffic or the traffic will be denied by the `default-deny-all` policy.

evidence.name: Kubernetes Workload GCP IAM Roles
evidence.description: This evidence shows the mapping of GKE k8s Service Accounts to their roles assigned in GCP.

controls.name: KSI-CNA-03
controls.description: Use logical networking and related capabilities to enforce traffic flow controls.

controlFamily.name: Cloud Native Architecture
controlFamily.description: A secure cloud service offering will use cloud native architecture and design principles to enforce and enhance the Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability of the system.

evidence.name: Architecture Diagram
evidence.description: This evidence shows The architecture diagram for the platform.

evidence.name: Firewall policy definitions applied to the network
evidence.description: This evidence shows all firewall policies on the system network that are active and enforce limiting inbound and outbound traffic based on country codes, destinations, traffic type.

evidence.name: Firewall rules limit inbound and outbound traffic
evidence.description: This evidence shows all firewall rules on the system network that are active and enforce limiting inbound and outbound traffic by port, direction and source IP.

controls.name: KSI-CNA-04
controls.description: Use immutable infrastructure with strictly defined functionality and privileges by default.

controlFamily.name: Cloud Native Architecture
controlFamily.description: A secure cloud service offering will use cloud native architecture and design principles to enforce and enhance the Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability of the system.

evidence.name: Gatekeeper enforcing requirement that containers must run as non-root user
evidence.description: This document shows the Gatekeeper policy that enforces containers must run as non-root user.

evidence.name: Gatekeeper enforcing limited volume types on containers
evidence.description: This document shows the Gatekeeper policy that enforces restricting mountable volume types to those that align with container immutability.

evidence.name: Gatekeeper enforcing read-only filesystems on containers
evidence.description: This document shows the Gatekeeper policy that enforces read-only filesystems for containers; a component of container immutability.

evidence.name: Gatekeeper enforcing requirement that pods define a seccomp profile
evidence.description: This document shows the Gatekeeper policy that enforces pods must have a seccomp profile defined and it must be one of the policy-defined values.

evidence.name: Gatekeeper enforcing privileged mode on containers
evidence.description: This document shows the Gatekeeper policy that enforces restricting the ability of any container to enable privileged mode.

controls.name: KSI-CNA-05
controls.description: Have denial of service protection.

controlFamily.name: Cloud Native Architecture
controlFamily.description: A secure cloud service offering will use cloud native architecture and design principles to enforce and enhance the Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability of the system.

evidence.name: Cloud Armor enabled on all public Cloud Load Balancer endpoints
evidence.description: This evidence shows all public Cloud Load Balancer endpoints have Cloud Armor policies enabled.

controls.name: KSI-CNA-06
controls.description: Design systems for high availability and rapid recovery.

controlFamily.name: Cloud Native Architecture
controlFamily.description: A secure cloud service offering will use cloud native architecture and design principles to enforce and enhance the Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability of the system.

evidence.name: SLA Documentation
evidence.description: This documentation outlines the SLAs for the platform that ensure high availability design principles to maximize uptime.

controls.name: KSI-INR-01
controls.description: Maintain an incident response plan that is coordinated with contingency planning.

controlFamily.name: Incident Response
controlFamily.description: A secure cloud service offering will implement and maintain a documented incident response plan, including coordination with contingency planning.

evidence.name: Contingency Plan
evidence.description: This Contingency Plan documents the processes for defining, maintaining, testing, and updating incident response and recovery capabilities to ensure minimal service disruption and data loss during incidents, fulfilling the requirements to define Recovery Time Objectives (RTO), Recovery Point Objectives (RPO), and to coordinate contingency and incident response planning and testing.

controls.name: KSI-INR-02
controls.description: Maintain a log of incidents and periodically review past incidents for patterns or vulnerabilities.

controlFamily.name: Incident Reporting
controlFamily.description: A secure cloud service offering will document, report, and analyze security incidents to ensure regulatory compliance and continuous security improvement.

evidence.name: Kube-bench recent scan results
evidence.description: This document shows the 10 most recent results from the kube-bench scanner.

evidence.name: Web App Scan Recent Runs
evidence.description: This evidence shows the most recent vulnerability scan executions against publicly accessible components.

evidence.name: Google SecOps (SIEM) Service Enabled
evidence.description: This evidence shows the GCP SecOps (SIEM) service is enabled. This is the centralized location for all security, vulnerability and audit logging for the system.

evidence.name: Kube-Bench Scan Logs
evidence.description: This evidence shows recent kube-bench STIG scan logs which occurs on a scheduled basis. These scans are used to harden and review system configurations.

evidence.name: Artifact Registry Vulnerability Scanner Status
evidence.description: This evidence shows that all artifact storage repositories have vulnerability scanning enabled.

controls.name: KSI-INR-03
controls.description: Test and update incident response plans regularly, incorporating lessons learned from incidents and exercises.

controlFamily.name: Incident Response

evidence.name: Contingency Plan

evidence.name: Incident Response Plan

evidence.description: Evidence showing ticket has been created for testing the backup plan

evidence.name: Encryption keys used on firestore databases
evidence.description: The presense of a cmek config in the database shows a customer managed kms key is being used. The absense of the cmek config shows a Google Managed Key is used.

evidence.name: Encryption keys used on storage accounts
evidence.description: The presense of a default_kms_key_name shows a customer managed kms key is being uses. A default_kms_key_name value of None shows a Google Managed Key is used.
